intro: Amaranthoides globosa, commonly known as the globe amaranth, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its compact, globe-shaped inflorescence composed of numerous small, brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. Its foliage is lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Amaranthoides globosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and compact growth habit.
